Description: A damaged ivory plaque: partially burnt, with an unknown amount lost from three sides. One surface is carved with figures of animals in three registers without dividing lines. At the top are two lions, then two bulls below them, and finally part of the figure of another quadruped, the identification of which is uncertain. All the figures face to the right.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.231 [196].
